welcome.data: Warm-up Prompt: “What do you think happens when the size of the screen changes and your elements are in a row?” Pair-share and class discussion.

aim.data: Today, we will explore the foundational layout model known as Flexbox and learn how to use justify-content and align-items to control alignment in one-dimensional layouts.

review.data: Discuss limitations of block/inline layouts and recap floats. Ask students to explain spacing methods from the last class.

relevant.data: Live code-along demonstrating display: flex, justify-content, and align-items with HTML and CSS examples in WebStorm.

interactive.data: Students create a horizontal navbar using Flexbox. Includes stretch goal for responsiveness.

ownership.data: Students create a Flexbox gallery with 6 images and push it to GitHub Pages.

resonate.data: Exit ticket: 'What is the difference between justify-content and align-items?'

supplies.data: Computers with WebStorm, GitHub access, projector, CSS snippets, link to CSS-Tricks Flexbox guide.
